channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Male flies sharpened their eyesight to call the females' bluff
item.description: With bloated bellies and hairy legs, female flies try to look bigger to get food from courting mates. But male flies, in turn, have sharpened their ey...

item.title: Spinal cord stimulation restores neural function, targets key feature of progressive neurodegenerative disease
item.description: Boosting communication between the spinal nerves and the muscles using the spinal cord stimulation reverses spinal muscle atrophy (SMA) progression an...

item.title: Scientists simulate asteroid collision effects on climate and plants
item.description: A new climate modeling study presents a new scenario of how climate and life on our planet would change in response to a potential future strike of a ...

item.title: Clean air policies having unintended impact driving up wetland methane emissions by up to 34 million tons
item.description: Reducing sulphur in the air may inadvertently increase natural emissions of methane from wetlands such as peatlands and swamps, a new study has found....

item.title: One in four chance per year that rocket junk will enter busy airspace
